title: I am... speechless. (PICTURE INTENSIVE)
body:
I created a support ticket to address my recent ban. Let's dive into the amazing customer service that this game has.

https://i.gyazo.com/316b09848088dc42d5b7961668da5ccc.png
https://i.gyazo.com/d51082cc5b29267f93c2f79286cccf6e.png

https://i.gyazo.com/143a90afffe6a03ba319610cd5bec7d1.png
https://i.gyazo.com/3e593ecdb8d92cbc955fb90b361cd925.png

I didn't fix any of the spelling, that's because I touch-type and often miss-press spacebar.

I never once asked for the ban to be removed. I simply asked for help in highlighting what part of what I said in the games was deemed 'toxic'. How am I meant to 'reform' if I'm just thrown logs? I honestly don't see what I said that could be considered toxic. It was banter, nothing more and nothing less. So, if any player wishes to aid me in highlighting what part was toxic, I would appreciate that so I can aim to not do it again in the future.

I never said I was going to 'run it down mid'... that's what Garen did. He spawned then ran straight down midlane and died. Elise did the same, hence the "Noob Elise, reported."

The issue is you don't see what the other players said.

The issue is never what the other players said. If they're consistently unsportsmanlike and reported frequently enough then they'll get what's coming to them. Your behaviour in return shouldn't mirror theirs. You're ruining the game for more than yourself and the players you're lashing out at. There are other players in your game (including the enemy team) who'd prefer you focus on playing rather than dragging your team down with infighting.

Regarding your ban: it was triggered by a manual review due to increasing reports against you, despite your recent chat restrictions, and unfortunately these sort of reviews don't deliver chat logs through the client yet. The games in question were actually played before the games sent to you by Player Support. That being said, the chat logs they quoted are reason enough for you to reflect on how you deal with frustration in game.

The guy who took your role was reported as well, but to put your usual behaviour in perspective you're reported about 18 times more often than him so it was inevitable that punishment systems eventually picked up on your behaviour.

Given that, my advice is to figure out how you can change your behaviour to better respond to frustration, be it how your team is playing or what they say.
You can't control whether or not your teammates make bad decisions. But reacting with anger and abuse isn't helping you.
You can't control whether or not other players are abusive, you CAN mute it out of the game. Take satisfaction from the fact that a muted player is talking at nothing if they carry on wasting their breath. If you report appropriately, consistently abusive players will be banned.
Watching two of my teammates go full keyboard warrior at each other frustrates me to no end, your other teammates probably feel the same and will likely report you.

Also, if you're having a bad day like the one that caused your manual review then stop playing, take a break and avoid carrying that frustration with you into more games. We talk about "bad days" for a reason when it comes to player behaviour - they seriously affect how you act and react towards other players. A player having a bad day and raging/trolling game after game is likely to be banned.

Hello, Riot Gehirn. Thank you for taking the time to break down what I did wrong. I appreciate that you actually did what I asked and didn't just post logs with zero context. I like to think that I just blank out and my mind takes over and does what it wants and I don't realise it. I don't remember typing half of what I said in those games.

I feel that my issue is that I simply give up far too easily and I cannot get back into the game. Despite the fact that I am a great player, mechanically, I am god awful when something goes wrong. As I have said before, I cannot actually mute people. I like to see what they say and if I can't, then I feel anxious about it. I like to think that a very small part of my mind likes having the last word, also.

I'm not sure if you can, but when this ban ends can you apply a permant chat restriction without it effecting rewards? If I can't type to them, then I can't and I won't be hit with this issue in the future.

> I feel that my issue is that I simply give up far too easily and I cannot get back into the game. 

When I hit level 20 back in 2012, I started getting really competitive. To the point where I got mad if my friends made mistakes that cost us the game, and I gave up trying instead of playing it out. I was an a-hole, and it took me a long time to change. What I had to come to terms with, and what you might need to realize as well, is that you can't win every game. There is a winner and loser, and sometimes you're the latter - and that's OK.
Make peace with that, and you'll start winning a lot more of those "unwinnable" games when you're not tilting yourself and your teammates off the face of the Earth by giving each other a hard time over mistakes. Surrender if that's what your team wants to do, but don't give up by focusing on mistakes rather than the game.

> I cannot actually mute people. I like to see what they say and if I can't, then I feel anxious about it. I like to think that a very small part of my mind likes having the last word, also.

I get what you mean, if I make a bad play that puts my team behind I may get anxious about how they might respond. But most players aren't going to waste everyone's time by setting their mouse aside and turning the game into a flame forum. The ones that do aren't worth anyone's attention. It's tough to get over, but you've got to try because your teammates will always get the last word on two dudes arguing by reporting them.

> can you apply a permanent chat restriction

Chat restrictions serve two purposes:
- to warn and reform players who are consistently unsportsmanlike (most chat restricted players never get another chat restriction)
- to reduce the amount of harm an unsportsmanlike player can do in a given game.

The thing is: if a chat restricted player isn't reforming, then they're likely to keep using their limited chats for negativity and abuse which means they'll keep being reported anyway. Players who don't reform even while chat restricted, eventually end up permabanned. That is why you've got to focus on improving your own behaviour rather than relying on a partial shield like chat restrictions to prevent yourself from being banned.
